definition: Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor
classifier for coins, rings, badges, pearls, sporting medals, rockets, satellites etc/tree trunk/whip/wooden peg, used as a gag for marching soldiers (old)
surname Mei
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
fine horse/thoroughbred
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
to be full of vigor (idiom)
a cut above/top quality
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
lit. the sun setting and the moon rising (idiom)/fig. the passage of time
flowering autumn grass, fine net (idiom); fig. abundant and exacting punishments prescribed by law
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
a show of strength
